body:
I would love something like this. We currently use a CollectionFixture to start a Mongo server (using the amazing Mongo2Go library) for the majority of our tests, but are using randomized collection names for each test to avoid having to clean up between each test. Since they can't conflict with each other, I would like to not prevent them from running in parallel and remove the collection definition.

edit: maybe `[ModuleInitializer]` would be a good workaround in some cases, but doesn't cover disposing.

The implementation I landed on is different from kzu's. It is dependent on an assembly-level attribute to specify the assembly fixture:

```csharp
[assembly: AssemblyFixture(typeof(MyFixture))]
```

Composition rules have been updated:

- Class fixtures can compose collection and assembly fixtures (accepted via ctor argument)
- Collection fixtures can compose assembly fixtures (accepted via ctor argument)

In addition, I added support for ctor arguments in all three fixtures for `ITestContextAccessor` (in addition to `_IMessageSink` for the diagnostic message sink).

I will update the online documentation soon to reflect all of this.

issue.title: When creating multiple OTel tracing pipelines, each of them subscribes to the sources and exports activities

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: Issues and pull requests which have been flagged for closing due to inactivity

issue.body: # Bug Report ```xml ``` Runtime version: net7.0 ## Symptom When OTel is configured multiple times in the same app (inevitable with multiple integration tests that run in parallel), multiple instances of the same activity are exported - each pipeline listens to all activities. **What is the expected behavior?** Listening to activities should be done once per process, and it should be possible to run integration tests and see exported (once) activities in the backend of choice. **What is the actual behavior?** Multiple instances of activities are exported: ## Reproduce [testing.zip](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet/files/10289758/testing.zip) 1. Try running all tests. Tests expect that each activity is exported once. They fail as each activity is exported as many times as there are active pipelines in the app (test classes) 2. Run individual test classes - they pass. 3. Check out jaeger. Each activity is exported 3 times.

body:
> In v3 the DatabaseFixture and CosmosDbFixture are always executed

This is by design, and aligned with how `IClassFixture<>` and `ICollectionFixture<>` are instantiated even if the test does not accept the fixture object via constructor argument. The assumption is that it's necessary for operation even if the test itself doesn't interact with it.

> Is this somehow possible OOTB with v3?

No, and not planned.

What you're describing is effectively what `ICollectionFixture<>` is designed for, to collect tests together with shared state. An assembly fixture by definition includes all tests, so they are all sharing the state.
My recommendation for your situation, if collection fixture is somehow not acceptable, is that you separate these tests into different assemblies.

> Running only the tests in class `MyCosmosTests` should only run the `CosmosDbFixture`.

I'm sorry, we have to agree to disagree.

> IMHO: The implementation of KZU with `IAssemblyFixture<SomeFixture>` allows the most fine granular control of the executed fixtures.

You're welcome to continue using it.
